Dear Nicole Marie Lawson:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code License recommendation
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12325
Section (1) An agency shall recommend to the department the
Description appropriate licensing action consistent with facts contained
in the foster home evaluation and any special evaluations.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The findings of fact for this investigation potentially warranted
adverse licensing action related to the foster parent’s license. The
agency established willful and substantial violations, yet the
agency recommended a CAP and no change in license status.
Investigation Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed the special evaluation report including the analysis,
findings, and recommendations. The agency findings
appropriately determined noncompliance with three foster home
licensing rules, Rules 403 (1)(a) and (b) Foster Parent Duties and
201(1)(d) Foster home applicant/licensee qualifications; central
registry check. However, the license recommendation did not fit
with the severity of the violation. The recommendation for the
license was to complete a CAP with no changes to the terms of
the license. Rule 403(a) was in noncompliance because the
foster parent acknowledged not following the safety plan for the
youth by giving the youth a cell phone. Rule 403(b) was in
noncompliance due to the foster parent not keeping the agency
fully informed regarding the progress/behaviors of the foster care
youth. Rule 201(1)(d) noncompliance was due to the foster parent
not demonstrating an adequate understanding of the proper care
of the youth by allowing the youth to have a tattoo needle/sharp
object so Youth A could pierce Youth A’s nose and belly button.
A stronger CAP was needed to ensure compliance with the areas
identified in noncompliance. A recommendation related to the
terms of the license related to a change in age and type of
appropriate behaviors for placement would also be acceptable.
Interviews:
I interviewed Administrator on 6/17/2024, 8/15/2024, and
8/16/2024 regarding my preliminary findings and final
determinations. Administrator stated the worker that completed
the foster home special evaluation that was reviewed is no longer
with the agency. Administrator stated that since the opening of
this special investigation the relevant agency staff have taken the
opportunity to review the situation and discuss various alternatives
to what can be done differently to avoid a future similar
occurrence/outcome.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance with rule 400.12325-1.
The outcome of the foster home evaluation was appropriate in
determining noncompliance with the rules associated with the
foster home evaluation. However, the recommendations
2

associated with that determination were inadequate to establish
compliance and ensure the maintenance of compliance. The
report did not indicate any consideration for modifying/considering
changes to what placement characteristics are appropriate for this
home.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2024C0000896SI; CAP approved 12/15/23
Rule Code License recommendation
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12325
Section (3) Except for an original license, an agency shall
Description recommend to the department the issuance of a regular
license or the continuation of an active license only when
all rules are in compliance, or both of the following
conditions exist:
(b) A written corrective action plan has been developed.
The plan must comply with all of the following
requirements:
(i) Upon determining a rule noncompliance that is
correctable by the foster parent, the agency must
develop a written corrective action plan with the
foster parent on the form prescribed by the
department.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Corrective action plan developed for the areas of noncompliance
is inadequate to establish compliance.
Investigation Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed the special evaluation report including the analysis,
findings, and recommendations. The agency findings
appropriately determined noncompliance with three foster home
licensing rules, Rules 403-1-a, 201-1-d, and 403-1-b. However,
the CAP that was developed to establish and maintain compliance
was inadequate.
The CAP that was reviewed for the foster home special evaluation
only identified Rule 403(1)(b) rule noncompliance. The only action
steps associated with the CAP was for the foster parent to attend
training related to parenting teens, and teens and trauma, and the
worker would follow up monthly to ensure the trainings were
completed.
3

Interviews:
I interviewed Administrator on 6/17/2024, 8/15/2024, and
8/16/2024 regarding my preliminary findings and final
determinations. Administrator stated the worker that completed
the foster home special evaluation and CAP that was reviewed is
no longer with the agency. Administrator stated that since the
opening of this special investigation the relevant agency staff have
taken the opportunity to review the situation and discuss various
alternatives to what can be done differently to avoid a future
similar occurrence/outcome.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance with rule 400.12325-3-b-i.
The outcome of the foster home evaluation was appropriate in
determining noncompliance with the rules associated with the
foster home evaluation. However, the corrective action plan
associated with that determination was inadequate to establish
compliance and ensure the maintenance of compliance.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.
